name: MahjonggTiles
description:
MahjonggTiles is a system-friendly version of the old ”mahjongg solitaire” (or ”Shanghai”, running in a window on any public screen.

The typical features of any Shanghai variant are available:
  • Undo move/suggest move
  • Different tilesets
  • Different tile arrangements
  • Timed games


The MahjonggTiles puts a lot of emphasis on the visual side of things. The direction of shadows can be defined, as can the window backdrop. Not only is a range of tilesets available, but more can be drawn by the user. A range of different tile arrangements, apart from the usual ”Dragon", can be loaded and even created using a bundled editor. For really lazy players, the game can be set to always show all available matching tiles. Rather uniquely, there is a store of removed bricks for browsing, similar to the history in your web browser. If you find that a tile you need has been removed earlier, you find it in the tile history in chronological removal order and can recall all moves back to that tile.
